page.description: Get a control anchor from a position - if position is ommitted, use mouse cursor position.

argument.name: dialog_name
argument.description: The name of the dialog box.

argument.name: x
argument.description: Optional. The horizontal coordinate of the dialog box.

argument.name: y
argument.description: Optional. The vertical coordinate of the dialog box.

page.discussion: The UI_DLG_CONTROL_ANCHOR_FROM_POS() function detects which anchor button receives the button click.

section.title: Example
section.description: This example shows how the command detects which button is pressed.
section.example: buttons1 = "{A=1}Sub-Button1{T=1.5}{A=2}Sub-Button2{T=3}{A=3}Sub-Button3" ui_modeless_dlg_box("Anchor Points",<<%dlg% {lf}; <%O={@@};B=M%=buttons1!button1>; %dlg%,<<%code% if a_dlg_button = "button1" then anchor = ui_dlg_control_anchor_from_pos("Anchor Points") ui_msg_box("Note","You just clicked on sub-button " + anchor + " in Button 1") else ui_modeless_dlg_close("Anchor Points") end if %code%)
